definition: Yangtze River Delta/abbr. for 長江三角洲|长江三角洲
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
Yangtze River Delta Economic Zone (economic region including Shanghai, Zhejiang and Jiangsu)
pinyin: Chang2 San1 jiao3 Jing1 ji4 Qu1

sentences.english: China has many water towns, especially in the Yangtze river delta area.
sentences.chinese: 中國的水城水鄉多，尤其是在長三角這個地區。

sentences.english: Besides, there are also encouraging responses from some well-known enterprises of small electric appliances of the Yangtze River Delta region.
sentences.chinese: 此外，長三角地區域著名小家電企業亦踊躍參展。

sentences.english: Lastly, the paper gives some consideration for related problems of YRD transportation.
sentences.chinese: 最後，是對長三角區域交通一體化相關問題的思考。

sentences.english: The keystone of this paper is the theoretical analyze of YRD transportation integration.
sentences.chinese: 本文的重點是對長三角地區交通一體化的理論分析。

sentences.english: Yangtze River Delta Region and Tokyo is the world's two typical urban agglomerations.
sentences.chinese: 中國長三角和日本東京圈是世界上兩大典型的城市羣。

sentences.english: Passenger and cargo transportation flow is in the direction of the Yangtze River Delta region.
sentences.chinese: 客貨運輸的主要流向是長三角方向。

sentences.english: Currently we have already had large number of partners in various photography equipment shopping marts in Delta.
sentences.chinese: 目前在長三角各大攝影器材城都有合作伙伴。

sentences.english: Autonomous innovation is the basic way for developing famous brad in Yang tze River delta.
sentences.chinese: 自主創新是長三角企業知名品牌成長的根本途徑。

sentences.english: An important component of the Yangtze River Delta is Suzhou, Wuxi and Changzhou.
sentences.chinese: 蘇錫常是長三角的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: The gap between Anhui Province and the Delta is becoming wider.
sentences.chinese: 安徽同長三角地區的差距在拉大。

sentences.english: Shengze is only an epitome of middle class in Yangtze Delta Area.
sentences.chinese: 富裕的盛澤人只是長三角中等收入羣體的一個縮影。

definition: (military) strategic town/(fig.) major center (for commerce, culture or tourism etc)
industry chain (concept proposed by US scholar Michael Porter in 1985)
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
